Jedan od pet miliona: 22. novembar krajnji rok - nećemo dozvoliti Malom da obori odluku Odbora BU

05 Nov 2019, 15:15









Aktivistkinja udruženja "Jedan od pet miliona" Mila Jovanović izjavila je danas da neće dozvoliti da nepoštovanje procedure Univerziteta u Beogradu (BU) omogući ministru finansija Siniši Malom da obori odluku Odbora za profesionalnu etiku BU o autentičnosti njegovog doktorata.Jovanović je na konferenciji za novinare u Rektoratu BU rekla da je 22. novembar krajnji rok, nakon kojeg neće biti pravnog prostora za odlaganje a da će odgovornost biti na profesorima koji su sugerisali da treba prihvatiti promenu roka koji je predložila rektorka BU Ivanka Popović."Ukoliko rok ne bude ispoštovan, mi pozivamo sve profesore da nas podrže i pridruže nam se u daljim akcijama", kazala je ona. Dogovorom kojim je prekinuta blokada Rektorata BU u septembru najavljeno je da će utvrdjivanje autentičnosti doktorata Malog biti završeno do 4. novembra.Medjutim, Popović je saopštila u ponedeljak da taj dogovor nije moguće sprovesti zbog poštovanja roka od 15 dana za podnošenje žalbe na odluku Naučno-nastavnog veća Fakulteta organizacionih nauka (FON) o javnoj osudi Malog zbog neakademskog ponašanja prilikom pisanja doktorata.Nakon tog saopštenja, aktivisti su pozvali profesore koji su podržali blokadu Rektorata da se izjasne da li je odlaganje donošenja odluke o doktoratu Malog za 15 dana zaista neophodno ili je namerno odugovlačenje."Dobili smo stav profesora i on je jedinstven. Oni veruju da do propusta u tumačenju procedure nije došlo namerno, iako mi nismo uvereni u to", kazala je Jovanović.Kako je istakla, članovi Jedan od pet miliona su uvereni da će odluka Etičke komisije BU biti "prava", jer, kako je navela, sve drugo bi bilo sramno."Dozvolićemo Malom da bude lažni doktor još 17 dana i da se oprosti od svoje lažne doktorske titule, ako mu za to nije bilo dovoljno šest godina", dodala je ona.

One in five million: November 22 deadline - we will not allow Mali to overturn the BU Board decision

05 Nov 2019, 14:15









One in five million activist Mila Jovanovic said today that she would not allow the University of Belgrade (BU) failure to comply with the finance minister Sinisa Mali's decision to rebut the BU Professional Ethics Committee's decision on the authenticity of his doctorate. She told the BU Rectorate that the deadline was November 22, after which there would be no legal space for postponement, and that it would be the responsibility of the professors who suggested that a change in the deadline proposed by BU Rector Ivanka Popovic should be accepted. "If the deadline is not met, we we invite all professors to support us and join us in further action, "she said. The agreement that ended the blockade of the BU Rectorate in September announced that the authentication of the doctorate of Mali would be completed by November 4. However, Popovic announced on Monday that the agreement could not be implemented because of the 15-day deadline for appealing of the Faculty of Organizational Sciences (FON) teaching panel on the public condemnation of Mali for non-academic conduct while writing a doctorate.After that announcement, activists called on professors who supported the blockade of the Rectorate to declare whether delaying the decision on a doctorate of Mali for 15 days was really necessary or "We got the professor's attitude and he is unique. They believe that a failure to interpret the procedure was not intentional, even though we are not convinced," Jovanovic said. As she pointed out, members of One in Five Million are convinced that the decision of the BU Ethics Commission would be "right" because, as she stated, everything else would be shameful. " to be a fake doctor for another 17 days and to say goodbye to his fake doctoral title if he didn't have six years to do it, "she added.
